title: Wait list from scratch
text: minimum information needed kidney transplant candidates encompasses: HLA typing, ABO blood group, cPRA, age, time dialysis, clinical urgency. can start defining wait list size (n) patientsâ€™ HLA according origin: Patientsâ€™ blood group can added abo() ages function ages(): Now must define groups sensitization transplant candidates according 4 elements vector probabilities corresponding cPRA = 0%; 1% < cPRA < 50%; 50% < cPRA < 85%; cPRA > 85%, respectively. Time dialysis (months) computed according blood group hipersensitation status: can finish defining patients clinical urgent ():
code: candidates <- hla_sample(n = 100, replace = TRUE, origin = 'API') #> New names: #> * `api` -> `api...4` #> * `afa` -> `afa...5` #> * `cau` -> `cau...6` #> * `his` -> `his...7` #> * `api` -> `api...11` #> * `afa` -> `afa...12` #> * `cau` -> `cau...13` #> * `his` -> `his...14`  # lets create also an unique identifier for each patient candidates$ID <- paste0('R', rownames(candidates))  candidates #> # A tibble: 100 x 7 #>    A1    A2    B1    B2    DR1   DR2   ID    #>    <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> #>  1 24    11    51    13    14    15    R1    #>  2 11    24    35    51    15    15    R2    #>  3 24    68    62    37    11    10    R3    #>  4 2     2     35    60    15    8     R4    #>  5 25    68    44    57    4     3     R5    #>  6 33    33    58    44    15    13    R6    #>  7 24    24    59    53    4     15    R7    #>  8 68    11    35    60    15    15    R8    #>  9 24    29    59    7     4     10    R9    #> 10 2     1     46    57    9     7     R10   #> # ... with 90 more rows # we just have to define sample size and probabilities for A, AB, B and O groups (in this order) candidates$bg <- abo(n = nrow(candidates), probs = c(0.4, 0.04, 0.06, 0.5))  # for patients' ages we define a trimmed normal distributed value with mean and sd candidates$age <- ages(n = nrow(candidates), lower = 18, upper = 80, mean = 65, sd = 30)  # let's take a look at our transplant candidates candidates #> # A tibble: 100 x 9 #>    A1    A2    B1    B2    DR1   DR2   ID    bg      age #>    <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <dbl> #>  1 24    11    51    13    14    15    R1    O        48 #>  2 11    24    35    51    15    15    R2    A        58 #>  3 24    68    62    37    11    10    R3    O        67 #>  4 2     2     35    60    15    8     R4    A        69 #>  5 25    68    44    57    4     3     R5    B        79 #>  6 33    33    58    44    15    13    R6    O        27 #>  7 24    24    59    53    4     15    R7    A        44 #>  8 68    11    35    60    15    15    R8    A        52 #>  9 24    29    59    7     4     10    R9    A        76 #> 10 2     1     46    57    9     7     R10   O        77 #> # ... with 90 more rows candidates$cPRA <- cpra(n = nrow(candidates), probs = c(0.7, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1))  # and we can also classify those hipersensitised patients candidates$hiper <- candidates$cPRA > 85 candidates <- candidates |>    dplyr::rowwise() |>   dplyr::mutate(dialysis = dial(hiper = hiper, bg = bg, seed.number = NA)) |>   dplyr::ungroup()  candidates #> # A tibble: 100 x 12 #>    A1    A2    B1    B2    DR1   DR2   ID    bg      age  cPRA hiper dialysis #>    <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <lgl>    <dbl> #>  1 24    11    51    13    14    15    R1    O        48     0 FALSE       66 #>  2 11    24    35    51    15    15    R2    A        58    73 FALSE       57 #>  3 24    68    62    37    11    10    R3    O        67     0 FALSE       90 #>  4 2     2     35    60    15    8     R4    A        69    37 FALSE       40 #>  5 25    68    44    57    4     3     R5    B        79    82 FALSE       23 #>  6 33    33    58    44    15    13    R6    O        27     0 FALSE       49 #>  7 24    24    59    53    4     15    R7    A        44    21 FALSE       40 #>  8 68    11    35    60    15    15    R8    A        52     0 FALSE       16 #>  9 24    29    59    7     4     10    R9    A        76     0 FALSE        2 #> 10 2     1     46    57    9     7     R10   O        77     0 FALSE       82 #> # ... with 90 more rows # letÂ´s asume we have 5% of candidates that are clinical urgent for transplantationn candidates$urgent <- sample(c(0,1), size = 100, replace = TRUE, prob = c(0.95,0.05))  # reording the columns candidates |>   dplyr::select(ID, bg, A1, A2, B1, B2, DR1, DR2, age, cPRA, hiper, dialysis, urgent) #> # A tibble: 100 x 13 #>    ID    bg    A1    A2    B1    B2    DR1   DR2     age  cPRA hiper dialysis #>    <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <lgl>    <dbl> #>  1 R1    O     24    11    51    13    14    15       48     0 FALSE       66 #>  2 R2    A     11    24    35    51    15    15       58    73 FALSE       57 #>  3 R3    O     24    68    62    37    11    10       67     0 FALSE       90 #>  4 R4    A     2     2     35    60    15    8        69    37 FALSE       40 #>  5 R5    B     25    68    44    57    4     3        79    82 FALSE       23 #>  6 R6    O     33    33    58    44    15    13       27     0 FALSE       49 #>  7 R7    A     24    24    59    53    4     15       44    21 FALSE       40 #>  8 R8    A     68    11    35    60    15    15       52     0 FALSE       16 #>  9 R9    A     24    29    59    7     4     10       76     0 FALSE        2 #> 10 R10   O     2     1     46    57    9     7        77     0 FALSE       82 #> # ... with 90 more rows, and 1 more variable: urgent <dbl>

title: Donors from scratch
text: can build scratch data frame pool donors using functions {simK} defining â€™s arguments pleased. minimum caracteristcs potential deseaced donors : blood group, HLA typing age. , start HLA typing defining pool size (n) â€™s origin: column donors blood group can added function abo(), just give donors pool size vector ABO genotypic frequencies (probs): Vector probs must corresponde , AB, B O probabilities (order). now just add vector donorsâ€™ age function ages():

title: Introduction to simK
text: package 3 main functions, can generate simulated data pool donors, set kidney transplant candidates respective HLA-antibodies patients HLA sensitized.

title: Introduction to simK
text: data frame information pool simulated donors can generated function donors_df(): given number rows n, data frame generated columns: ID unique identifier prefix â€˜Dâ€™; bg blood group generated parameter probs vector probabilities groups , AB, B O, respectively; A1, A2, B1, B2, DR1, DR2 HLA typing obtained according origin option (replace = TRUE can generate data frame without limitations number rows); age generated Normal distribution mean sd given user, values truncated lower upper boundaries; DRI option uk = TRUE, Donor Risk Index copmputed described transplantr HLA population origin currently valid options â€˜PTâ€™ Portuguese, populations available US National Marrow Donor Program: â€˜APIâ€™ - Asian / Pacific Islander â€˜AFAâ€™ - African American / Black â€˜CAUâ€™ - White / Caucasian â€˜â€™ - Hispanic Defining seed.number allows reproducibility. :information_source: compute DRI decribed transplantr, generated variables: height (\(N(165,20)\)); hypertension (probability \(0.43\)); sex (probability \(0.55\) man); CMV+ (probability \(0.9\)); hospital stay (\(P(\lambda = 4)\)); GFR age (<30 \(N(116,10)\); 30-39 \(N(107,10)\); 40-49 \(N(99,10)\); 50-59 \(N(93,10)\); 60-69 \(N(85, 10)\); >=70 \(N(75, 10)\))

title: Introduction to simK
text: simulated waiting list kidney transplant candidates, can generated candidates_df(): given number n rows, data frame generated columns: ID unique identifier prefix â€˜Kâ€™; bg blood group generated parameter probs.abo vector probabilities groups , AB, B O, respectively (default, assumed group O patients frequent); A1, A2, B1, B2, DR1, DR2 HLA typing obtained according origin option (replace = TRUE can generate data frame without limitations number rows); age generated Normal distribution mean sd given user, values truncated lower upper boundaries; dialysis time dialysis months, values computed according patientsâ€™ blood group hypersensitation status (cPRA > 85%): patients blood group O Hypersinsitized time dialysis obtained N(85, 20); patients blood O Hypersinsitized \(N(70,20)\); remaining patients time dialysis obtained \(N(35,20)\); cPRA patients classified groups probabilities given probs.cpra 0%, 1%-50%, 51%-85% 86%-100%, respectively. Within groups > 0%, cPRA computed random values distributions \(P(\lambda = 30)\), \(P(\lambda = 70)\) \(P(\lambda = 90)\); Tier patients classified two Tiers described POL186/11 â€“ Kidney Transplantation: Deceased Donor Organ Allocation UK transplant. Tier patients MS = 10 cPRA = 100% time dialysis > 7 years, remaing patients classified Tier B; MS matchabilily score deciles obtained number donors dataset D10K match transplant candidate. score takes account patientâ€™s blood type, HLA type cPRA value. patient MS = 1 defined easy match MS = 10 difficult match. RRI option uk = TRUE, Recipient Risk Index copmputed described transplantr. compute RRI, variables age, time dialysis (days) probability diabetic (obtained prob.dm) used. Also, assumed patients dialysis time listing. urgent diccotomic variavel assumes 1 clinical urgent patients. â€™s generated prob.urgent. HLA population origin can defined options: â€˜PTâ€™,â€˜APIâ€™,â€˜AFAâ€™,â€˜CAUâ€™ â€˜â€™, reported donors_df() data frame. Defining seed.number allows reproducibility.
code: candidates_df(n = 10,                replace = TRUE,               origin = 'PT',               probs.abo = c(0.43, 0.03, 0.08, 0.46),               probs.cpra = c(0.7, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1),               lower=18, upper=75,               mean = 45, sd = 15,               prob.dm = 0.12,               prob.urgent = 0.05,               uk = FALSE,               seed.number = 3) #> # A tibble: 10 x 13 #>    ID    bg    A1    A2    B1    B2    DR1   DR2     age  cPRA hiper dialysis #>    <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <chr> <dbl> <dbl> <lgl>    <dbl> #>  1 K1    O     1     29    8     44    11    7        37     0 FALSE       80 #>  2 K2    A     2     3     7     57    4     8        42     0 FALSE       49 #>  3 K3    O     11    33    14    35    1     13       68     0 FALSE       49 #>  4 K4    O     24    30    49    58    11    11       46     0 FALSE       36 #>  5 K5    A     2     3     7     51    1     13       47    76 FALSE       38 #>  6 K6    A     30    68    15    18    3     4        71    25 FALSE       44 #>  7 K7    O     3     26    18    40    11    13       52    91 TRUE        99 #>  8 K8    O     1     1     7     8     3     13       26     0 FALSE       69 #>  9 K9    A     3     3     7     44    15    8        35     0 FALSE       27 #> 10 K10   A     11    29    44    57    7     7        38     0 FALSE       10 #> # ... with 1 more variable: urgent <dbl>

title: Introduction to simK
text: function Abs_df() allows generate data frame HLA antibodies candidates waiting list: inputs, function requires data set ID patients HLA information (HLA typing cPRA value) format provided candidates_df(). Defining seed.number allows reproducibility. HLA population origin must defined accordance functions candidates_df(). PT origin, functions rely HLA typing intermediate resolution described Lima et al, 2013. NMDP populations, HLA typing described Gragert et al, 2013
code: Abs_df(candidates = candidates_df(n=10),        origin = 'PT',        seed.number = 3) #> # A tibble: 35 x 2 #>    ID    abs   #>    <chr> <chr> #>  1 K5    A25   #>  2 K5    DR4   #>  3 K5    A34   #>  4 K5    B53   #>  5 K5    B49   #>  6 K5    DR4   #>  7 K5    B54   #>  8 K5    B57   #>  9 K5    B44   #> 10 K5    A30   #> # ... with 25 more rows

text: ðŸŽ¯ Functions procedurally generate synthetic data R kidney transplant simulations. can see simK action, . simK allows generate data clinical demographic information pool simulated cadaveric donors simulated wait listed candidates kidney transplantation. Synthetic data can used preliminary analysis development analysis code. Data generated simK particularly useful KARS. âš ï¸ package medical device used making clinical decisions.

title: A data frame with donors characteristics â€” candidates_df
code: candidates_df(   n = 10,   replace = TRUE,   origin = "PT",   probs.abo = c(0.43, 0.03, 0.08, 0.46),   probs.cpra = c(0.7, 0.1, 0.1, 0.1),   lower = 18,   upper = 75,   mean.age = 45,   sd.age = 15,   prob.dm = 0.12,   prob.urgent = 0.05,   uk = FALSE,   seed.number = 3 )

title: A data frame with donors characteristics â€” candidates_df
text: n integer define number rows replace logical value sampling replacement origin character value population origin options: 'PT', 'API', 'AFA', 'CAU' '' probs.abo vector probabilities blood group , AB, B O (order). sum probabilities must equal one. probs.cpra vector probabilities cPRA groups 0%, 1%-50%, 51%-84%, 85%-100% (order). sum probabilities must equal one. lower integer ages' lower limit. upper integer ages' upper limit. mean.age value mean age's distribution. sd.age value standard deviation age's distribution. prob.dm value probability Diabetes Mellitus. prob.urgent value probability clinical urgent. uk logical value, TRUE also computed Donor Risk Index (DRI). seed.number numeric seed used random number generation.

title: A data frame with donors characteristics â€” candidates_df
text: data frame HLA typing, blood group, truncated ages, time dialysis (months), cPRA, Tier, MS RRI (last 3, uk = TRUE) simulated group transplant candidates.

title: Gives time on dialysis in months â€” dial
text: hiper logical value hipersensitized patients (cPRA > 85%). bg character value blood group. mean.dial1 time dialysis mean value patients neither Hipersensitized blood group O, used Normal distribution value generation. mean.dial2 time dialysis mean value patients Hipersensitized blood group O, used Normal distribution value generation. mean.dial3 time dialysis mean value patients Hipersensitized blood group O, used Normal distribution value generation. sd.dial time dialysis standard deviation, used Normal distribution value generation. seed.number Seed pseudo random number generator. NA seed applicable.

title: A data frame with donors caracheristics â€” donors_df
code: donors_df(   n = 10,   replace = TRUE,   origin = "PT",   probs = c(0.4658, 0.0343, 0.077, 0.4229),   lower = 18,   upper = 75,   mean.age = 60,   sd.age = 12,   uk = FALSE,   seed.number = 3 )

title: A data frame with donors caracheristics â€” donors_df
text: n integer define number rows replace logical value sampling replacement origin character value population origin options: 'PT', 'API', 'AFA', 'CAU' '' probs vector probabilities blood group , AB, B O (order). sum probabilities must equal one. lower integer ages' lower limit. upper integer ages' upper limit. mean.age value mean age's distribution. sd.age value standard deviation age's distribution. uk logical value, TRUE also computed Donor Risk Index (DRI) seed.number numeric seed used random number generation.

title: A data frame with donors caracheristics â€” donors_df
text: data frame HLA typing, blood group truncated ages simulated group transplant donors.

Matchability from D10K â€” matchability
text: Computes number donors dataset D10K match given transplant candidate. sample D10K selected according cPRA value, afterwards donors ABO identical HLA mismatch level 1 2 (0 DR (1 DR 0 B)) filtered.

title: Matchability from D10K â€” matchability
code: matchability(   cABO = "A",   cPRA = 85,   cA = c("2", "29"),   cB = c("7", "15"),   cDR = c("4", "7"),   seed.number = 3 )

title: Matchability from D10K â€” matchability
text: cABO character '', 'B', 'AB', 'O' cPRA candidate's cPRA value cA candidate's HLA-typing cB candidate's HLA-B typing cDR candidate's HLA-DR typing seed.number numeric seed used random number generation.

title: Matchability from D10K â€” matchability
text: Match Score measure difficult match patient organ donor. score 1 (easy match) 10 (difficult match).

title: Matchability from D10K â€” matchability
code: matchability(cABO = 'A', cPRA = 85, cA = c('2','29'), cB = c('7','15'), cDR = c('4','7'), seed.number = 3) #> [1] 67
